news.title: Paintmakers flag intense competition, pricing pressure; pin hopes on demand recovery in Q4 FY26
news.para: With the March quarter approaching, top Indian paint players project higher demand and volumes amid fierce rivalry. Asian Paints, Kansai Nerolac, Berger Paints, and AkzoNobel India are lining up strategies to capture momentum. Growth is likely supported by infrastructure expansion and resilient consumer expenditure, even as new players enter the arena.

news.title: Ambala Cantonment to become a metropolis, seven new sectors planned: Haryana minister
news.para: Ambala Cantonment is set for a major expansion. Haryana minister Anil Vij announced plans for seven new sectors. This development will significantly increase the city's size. It will also upgrade residential and civic facilities. The project aims to transform Ambala Cantt into a metropolitan hub. Landowners can apply to sell land for this ambitious urban growth initiative.

news.title: Mumbai: BMC House seeks property tax relief for 700 sq ft homes
news.para: Mumbai's civic body has passed a motion to raise the property tax exemption for residential units from 500 to 700 sqft. This move aims to ease the financial burden on middle-class families, particularly those in redeveloped slum properties. While the proposal requires administrative approval, it reflects a key election promise to retain original Mumbaikars in the city.

news.title: Wayanad landslide survivors move into new homes as Kerala CM opens model township
news.para: 178 families of Wayanad landslide survivors received new homes as Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurated the Wayanad Model Township. The project delivers housing plus amenities and marks a pivotal step in rehabilitation, aiming to rebuild lives with dignity. The government also provided financial assistance and land titles, with a commitment that all survivors will be rehabilitated before the next monsoon.

news.title: Wall Street hit by Market ​Financial Solutions' collapse, raising fears of more credit 'cockroaches'
news.para: A UK mortgage specialist, Market Financial Solutions Ltd, has collapsed, sending shockwaves through Wall Street lenders and fueling fears of further losses in the booming private credit market. The collapse triggered a sharp slide in the shares of major banks, including Barclays and Jefferies.

news.title: Chandigarh set to amend its master plan 2031
news.para: Chandigarh is set to amend its Master Plan-2031 for the first time in over a decade, aiming to modernize urban planning and optimize land use. These reforms, driven by the central government's 'Deregulation 2.0' initiative, will allow for higher building heights, increased FAR, and greater flexibility in industrial zones, while preserving the city's heritage.

news.title: Master plan 2041 to get nod soon: Delhi CM
news.para: Delhi's Master Plan 2041 is nearing approval, according to Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, who presented her government's one-year report card. This plan aims to guide the capital's development for the next two decades, addressing a policy gap left by the lapsed Master Plan 2021.

news.title: Kerala CM to provide keys of 178 houses on March 1
news.para: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan will inaugurate a model township for Mundakkai-Chooralmala landslide survivors in Wayanad on Sunday.  The first phase provides homes to 178 families who lost everything.  These 1000 sq ft single-storey houses are built with provisions for a second floor.  Beneficiaries will receive title deeds, land ownership, and utility connections.

news.title: Prayagraj: Fixed fee system for property mutation to ease financial burden on buyers
news.para: Prayagraj Municipal Corporation has introduced a fixed-fee system for property mutation, replacing the previous percentage-based charges. This move significantly reduces the financial burden on property owners, with a cap of Rs 10,000 for properties valued above Rs 50 lakh. The new structure aims to simplify civic services and make the mutation process more affordable for residents.

news.title: Private entities to run 60 property registration centres; Pune, Mumbai to have facilities in first phase
news.para: Maharashtra government will launch 60 new property registration offices across the state. These centres will be run by private institutions alongside existing government offices. The aim is to improve efficiency and reduce waiting times for citizens. The new facilities will offer enhanced amenities. However, an additional service fee will be applicable.

news.title: About 120 unsafe buildings found across 18 districts in Odisha: Government survey
news.para: Odisha's government has identified 120 unsafe buildings across 18 districts, including schools, hospitals, and government offices. Cuttack leads with 22 such structures. Local bodies are instructed to survey and propose demolition or reconstruction for these aging and fragile buildings, following a recent tragedy where a balcony collapse claimed lives.

news.title: ED attaches ₹14 crore assets in Sai Surya Developers cheating case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate in Hyderabad has provisionally attached immovable properties worth Rs 14 crore belonging to Sai Surya Developers. The agency's investigation, based on Telangana police FIRs, revealed a fraudulent scheme where proprietor Sathish Chandra Gupta allegedly collected money from depositors for plots but failed to register them, leading to significant financial losses for investors.

news.title: MDA puts 200 sites on block as demand surges in Mysuru
news.para: Mysuru Development Authority is auctioning around 200 commercial and residential sites in late March and early April. Premium corner plots in west Mysuru are priced between Rs 3.3 crore and Rs 3.5 crore, reflecting strong demand and anticipated future development in the area. Other sites range from Rs 1 crore to Rs 2.5 crore.

news.title: Vipul's CEO arrested for duping lawyers of ₹6 crore in Gurugram
news.para: Gurugram police have arrested Puneet Beriwala, CEO of Vipul Limited, for allegedly duping lawyers of Rs 6 crore. Beriwala promised high returns on an investment in a real estate project but failed to deliver. He has been sent to two-day police custody for further investigation.

news.title: Four brick kilns demolished in Ganjam
news.para: Authorities in Ganjam district have taken action against illegal brick kilns. Four units in Aska tehsil were demolished for operating without proper permissions and violating environmental regulations. These kilns were found to be causing air pollution and posing threats to local resources. The administration is continuing its search for other illegal operations in the region.

news.title: JK Cement commissions ₹500 crore, three MTPA plant in Bihar’s Buxar
news.para: JK Cement has inaugurated its first manufacturing plant in Buxar, Bihar, with a capacity of 3 million tonnes per year. The ₹500 crore facility is expected to slash logistics costs and accelerate deliveries to the Bihar market, reducing reliance on supplies from the Prayagraj plant in Uttar Pradesh.

news.title: Cement consolidation hasn’t hurt us, focus is profitable growth to 30 MTPA: JK Lakshmi Cement
news.para: JK Lakshmi Cement plans a significant capacity expansion to 30 million tonnes per annum. The company will focus on its established East, North, and West regions. This strategy aims to enhance market presence and operational efficiency. New integrated units and grinding stations are part of the plan. The company is also introducing a new low-carbon cement product.

news.title: J&K RERA targets 100 project registrations as new master plans near notification
news.para: Jammu & Kashmir Real Estate Regulatory Authority is driving structural reforms and stricter enforcement of layout norms. Revised master plans for Jammu and Srinagar are nearing notification. A 450-acre land parcel in Srinagar is slated for monetisation. Government agencies must register projects with RERA. The authority aims for a regulated and planned real estate ecosystem across the Union Territory.

news.title: Rajasthan Housing Board revenue crosses ₹1,000 crore; new launches planned in 2026
news.para: Rajasthan Housing Board (RHB) has significantly boosted its revenue, exceeding ₹1,000 crore in FY26 due to strong commercial auctions and asset monetization. The board is now planning new residential schemes across various towns and exploring private participation to expand capacity while maintaining affordability.

news.title: Defaulters clear ₹27 lakh pending property tax ahead of auction in Bengaluru
news.para: Fear of property auctions prompted 14 defaulters in Bommanahalli to clear over Rs 27 lakh in pending dues before a Greater Bengaluru Authority auction. While this action recovered significant taxes, 36 properties remained unsold, with a re-auction planned for the outstanding arrears.
